decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressively and efficiently, utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Lightning Bolt to apply pressure on the opponent. It aims to control the board using counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland. The deck also includes some card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Mishra's Bauble to maintain card advantage and find the right answers when needed. Overall, the strategy is to be proactive and control the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game, with cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Exploration to accelerate land drops. The key strategy involves utilizing Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam to fetch key lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful token combo. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Sphere of Resistance and Wasteland to slow down opponents, while also utilizing Urza's Saga to tutor for specific artifacts. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through powerful land interactions and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes efficient disruption spells like Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Daze to control the game and protect its threats. The deck aims to continuously draw cards and manipulate the top of the deck with cards like Mishra's Bauble, Brainstorm, and Ponder to maintain tempo and consistency. Additionally, it includes a mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This Legacy deck focuses on fast-paced aggression using low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells such as Force of Will and Daze while constantly replenishing resources with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Ponder. With a mix of tempo plays and disruptive elements like Wasteland, this deck's strategy revolves around applying pressure early and maintaining dominance throughout the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Brainstorm to disrupt the opponent's plans while also drawing cards and generating value with cards like Life from the Loam and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck also has a toolbox of different creatures and spells to deal with various threats, ensuring that it can adapt to different situations and come out on top in the long game.

This deck focuses on quickly casting powerful creatures and spells with cascade mechanics, overwhelming the opponent with threats and disruption. By using cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst to cascade into powerful spells like Crashing Footfalls and LÃ³rien Revealed, the deck aims to apply pressure and control the board to secure victory. With a mix of aggressive creatures, countermagic, and land disruption, the deck seeks to keep opponents on the back foot while pushing towards a fast win.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Dark Depths combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token by removing all ice counters. It includes cards like Crop Rotation and Elvish Reclaimer to search for the key combo pieces, while also running cards like Thespian's Stage to copy Dark Depths. Other cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Green Sun's Zenith provide additional ways to search for combo pieces, while also including disruptive cards like Gaddock Teeg to protect the combo. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful 20/20 token.

This deck focuses on using lands to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Crop Rotation, Life from the Loam, and Exploration to quickly assemble powerful land combinations like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. Utilizing lands like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter, the deck can disrupt the opponent's mana base while protecting its own with cards like Maze of Ith and Karakas. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through resource denial and powerful land interactions.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy aggro deck is to disrupt your opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while quickly putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck aims to lock down the board with powerful Stax effects and prevent the opponent from effectively casting their spells, all while dealing consistent damage and closing out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to drop powerful threats like Dragon Stompy and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon. It aims to control the board with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and burn spells like Fury, while also locking opponents out of playing their spells with Magus of the Moon and Trinisphere. The deck's strategy revolves around punishing opponents for playing non-basic lands and overwhelming them with fast, efficient threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will, as well as efficient removal like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower provides additional threats and versatility, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and ultimately leading to a quick victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and disrupting the opponent with counter spells and removal. It seeks to control the game early on with cheap spells like Delver of Secrets and Lightning Bolt, while also utilizing disruptive cards like Daze and Force of Will. The mana base is built around utilizing land destruction with cards like Wasteland, while also providing the necessary colors for the deck. The goal is to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Legacy High Tide combo deck is to generate large amounts of mana using High Tide and Sapphire Medallion to cast powerful spells like Mind's Desire and Time Spiral. The deck utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to filter through the deck quickly and find key pieces. Control elements like Force of Will and Snap are also included to protect the combo. The deck aims to generate a huge amount of mana, cast multiple spells in one turn, and ultimately win the game through a powerful combo sequence.

The deck focuses on leveraging the synergies and abilities of Merfolk creatures, aiming to establish early board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Lord of Atlantis, Master of the Pearl Trident, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also plays disruptive spells like Force of Will and Tidebinder Mage to control the opponent's plays and protect its own creatures. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for instant-speed creature deployment, while Wasteland and Cavern of Souls provide additional utility and mana fixing.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Mystic Forge combo deck focuses on utilizing artifacts such as Mox Opal, Lotus Petal, and various mana rocks to generate mana quickly and efficiently. The goal is to set up a lock with Mystic Forge and Paradox Engine, allowing you to cast spells from the top of your library with ease. Cards like The One Ring, Manifold Key, and Voltaic Key help to further the combo potential, while Defense Grid protects your strategy from disruption. Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga provide additional toolbox options to enhance your game plan.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around quickly putting powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The deck also includes Atraxa, Grand Unifier and The One Ring to further enhance the abilities of these creatures. With access to counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as card draw and manipulation like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures before they can react effectively.

This Control deck focuses on a combination of powerful control spells and efficient card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. The deck utilizes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and versatile threats like Uro to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It also features some unique cards like Leyline Binding and Dress Down to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana needed to support the deck's powerful spells.

This deck is focused on card advantage and control, utilizing powerful spells like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Teferi, Time Raveler to manipulate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw effects, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish board control. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the late game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolored spells and ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also using burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Price of Progress, and Fireblast to finish them off. The primary strategy is to consistently chip away at the opponent's life total with efficient and direct damage spells, controlling the board with cards like Roiling Vortex, and utilizing Barbarian Ring as a late-game finisher.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo to quickly create a 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token. It uses cards like Elvish Reclaimer, Crop Rotation, and Knight of the Reliquary to tutor for Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, which can copy Dark Depths to create the token immediately. The deck also includes disruption elements like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland to control the board while setting up the combo. The goal is to efficiently assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with the powerful Marit Lage token.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents while deploying threats quickly, utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic to find equipment and Mother of Runes to protect key creatures. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben taxes opponents' spells and Urza's Saga provides additional value. Aether Vial allows for instant-speed creature deployment, while cards like Swords to Plowshares deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds a potential advantage late in the game with its ability to blink multiple creatures for value. Overall, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure with aggressive creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing Death's Shadow and Grief to quickly overwhelm opponents with high-powered creatures. It also includes efficient removal and disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to control the game. Reanimate allows for powerful creatures to be brought back from the graveyard, while brazen borrower and Orcish Bowmasters provide additional threats and utility. The deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to increase the power of Death's Shadow while disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption and counterspells. It utilizes cards like Grief and Thoughtseize to strip key cards from your opponent's hand, as well as combining Reanimate with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Troll of Khazad-dÃ»m. The deck also has access to efficient removal spells like Dismember and Snuff Out, as well as land destruction with Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Doomsday deck is to efficiently find and cast the card Doomsday, which allows the player to stack their deck in a specific order to win the game. The deck includes cards like Brainstorm, Dark Ritual, and Personal Tutor to help set up the Doomsday combo quickly, along with counter spells like Force of Will to protect the combo. Thassa's Oracle is used as a win condition after casting Doomsday to secure victory. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game before the opponent can disrupt the plan.

The main goal of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also applying aggressive pressure with creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Broadside Bombardiers. Cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Unlicensed Hearse provide additional reach and card advantage, allowing the deck to close out games quickly. The deck aims to lock the opponent out of the game by denying them resources, while simultaneously deploying threats to end the game before they can recover.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to put pressure on the opponent. By combining efficient creatures with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to control the board and keep opponents on the back foot. The inclusion of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Molten Collapse adds reach, allowing the deck to finish off opponents quickly. With a mix of card draw, disruption, and aggression, this Grixis Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and versatile game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive swarm of Goblins on the battlefield, utilizing powerful Goblins such as Goblin Rabblemaster, Goblin Ringleader, and Muxus, Goblin Grandee. The deck also includes various support cards like Chalice of the Void and Chrome Mox to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Battle Cry Goblin and The One Ring provide additional ways to increase the offensive capabilities of the Goblins, while lands like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Tomb help ensure the Goblins hit the battlefield quickly and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures and artifacts to overwhelm the opponent's defenses and secure a fast victory. By utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, Goblin Engineer, and Broadside Bombardiers, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal allow for explosive plays and quick mana acceleration. The deck also features a mix of creatures and artifact synergies to create a versatile and dynamic strategy that can adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on using Stifle and other control spells to disrupt opponents' strategies while also utilizing Phyrexian Dreadnought as a powerful threat. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides card advantage and a resilient threat, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to smooth out draws. The mana base includes cards like Wasteland and Flooded Strand to disrupt opponents' mana bases. The addition of Dress Down can help deal with problematic creatures or abilities. The deck aims to control the game and win through efficient threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana using cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond to cast powerful spells like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony. It uses cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck aims to win by chaining spells together to generate a storm count and then finishing the opponent off with a large Tendrils of Agony or Past in Flames. It also utilizes Wishclaw Talisman to tutor for key combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently put powerful creatures into the graveyard, either through discarding or sacrificing, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows the player to cheat powerful creatures into play early in the game, giving them a significant advantage over their opponent. The deck also includes disruption and card selection spells to protect the combo and find the necessary pieces to execute it successfully.

This control deck focuses on utilizing countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset, along with versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Brainstorm, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. With a mix of traditional control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, along with newer cards like Prismatic Ending and Dress Down, the deck has answers to a wide range of threats and strategies. Ultimately, the goal is to establish control of the game and grind out a win through incremental advantage.
